alert.note: Alert for Sheridan; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 11:36PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cherry and southern Sheridan Counties through 1130 PM MDT... At 1035 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Merriman to 19 miles southeast of Gordon to 13 miles north of Antioch. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cody, Merriman, Medicine Lake, Eli, Big Hill, Dipping Vat Meadow, Billys Lake, Irwin, Intersection of Highway 61 and Survey Valley Road, Rock Hill, Diamond Lake, Indian Hill, Watson Lake, Highway 61 crossing the Snake River, Morgan Lake, Finnegan Lake, Schoolhouse Lake, Smith Lake, Intersection of Highway 20 and Irwin Road and Bayonne. This includes the following highways... Highway 20 between mile markers 116 and 164. Highway 250 between mile markers 11 and 29. Highway 61 between mile markers 180 and 231. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
